page.title: 05Social Concerns in Johnstone
page.content: Being directly on the flight path of the nearby Glasgow Airport, aircraft noise is a major nuisance in Johnstone. Despite local petitions, the problem of noise continues to grow as the number of flights increase. There is a small chemical factory situated on the Beith Road(A737). There has been local fears that the chemical wastes are causing a high rate of cancer in the housing scheme behind the factory. These claims, however, have not been verified. Local concern over road safety has been centred on convoys of coal lorries, travelling from Hunterston to Ravenscraig as a result of the miners strike in '84. Since the end of the miners strike local protests to have all coal taken by rail have failed and some convoys still continue.
